jobs.position: Front End Development Consultant for PBS Digital

jobdutys.desc: Primary liaison between PBS Interactive (PBSi) internal design team and outsourced development teams. Ensure that aesthetic and functional requirements are communicated effectively to outsourced teams in U.S.A. & Romania. Ensure delivered product meets aesthetic and functional requirements.
Meet code production commitments usually involving creating static builds from Photoshop PSDs and integrating them with Django templates, or by retrofitting design to existing HTML and JavaScript.

Assist site analytics team when needed. They use Google Analytics, but previous experience with Omniture SiteCatalyst proved useful in these cases. After implementing Google Tag Manager, the analytics team has had less need for developer consultations.

Play “senior” role in a small team responsible for recommending and implementing Front End best practices. This includes effective use of modern Front End technologies such as Less, Grunt, and Bower. Also involved in decision-focused meetings with PBSi technical stakeholders to evaluate software development practices, and Front End frameworks.

Work with designers, project managers, and account executives on Web applications for clients to bring static designs to life as Django-backed websites. Manage the flow of Web site maintenance requests from clients to junior developers. Train junior developers as needed. Manage software development life cycle on assigned projects. Expected to be primary point of contact for project managers and account executives regarding project status. Participate in development by maintaining existing Flash, Django, and Wordpress projects.

Front-end Web Developer with a focus on interactive media design and development. Expected to take technical lead on projects as assigned. These duties include using Agile methodologies and consulting with designers, editors, marketing, advertising, and other engineers to plan the technical side of projects. Responsible for keeping tasks up to date in the Jira tracking system. Responsible for taking static mockups and turning them into fully functional Web applications.

Web development responsibilities include devising and implementing standards and best practices for the HTML, CSS, & JavaScript of The Slate Group Web sites. Responsible for supporting the front end and JSP layer of our current content management system, CQ5. Share responsibility with team members for tagging and deploying code from our Git repositories to production servers in Amazon’s cloud (AWS). Maintain custom GUI’s in CQ5 based in Ext JS.
This is the same position listed above, but as a contractor.

Oversee day-to-day general and administrative functions of the company. Sales duties include identifying/qualifying leads, meeting with prospective customers, drafting proposals, and negotiating contracts.  Project Management duties include managing a team of developers for smaller, quick turn-around projects. Web design and development duties include art director for all SEI-developed Web sites, creating graphics, developing Web pages, creating Web applications with FileMaker and XSLT.

Develop and maintain a FileMaker Pro database system including migrating existing database applications from FileMaker version 6 to FileMaker version 8.  Gather requirements from reporters and editors to incorporate into new applications and upgrades of current applications.  Provide help desk support for database-related support requests.  Work with Web programmers to publish data to the company Web sites and print publications, The Chronicle of Higher Education and the Chronicle of Philanthropy. Design and implement Web interfaces to databases using XSLT.

Apply knowledge of purchasing policies and procedures, legal aspects, markets, and vendors in procuring material requirements in a timely manner.  Review requisitions, analyze quotations, select or recommend vendors, initiate purchase orders. Perform cost-price analysis as needed.
